QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Systemic
QAPair.Answer: Systemic means affecting the entire body, rather than a single organ or body part. For example, systemic disorders, such as high blood pressure , or systemic diseases, such as influenza (the flu ), affect the entire body. An infection that is in the bloodstream is called a systemic infection. An infection that affects only one body part or organ is called a localized infection.
